eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Sticker
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make objects follow the position and rotation of the object they are stuck to.
description: This extension can be useful to:
* Stick accessories to moving objects
* Animate a skeleton
* Delete an object with another one
An example allows to check it out ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://stick-objects)).

eventsFunctions.description: Define helper classes JavaScript code.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineHelperClasses

inlineCode: * Update the coordinates in the basisObject basis.
* It uses the basisObject coordinates from the previous frame.
* This way, the sticker can move relatively to it and still
// Save initial values to avoid calculus and rounding errors
* Copy the coordinates to use it the next frame.
* This method is also called by children to ensure
// If the behavior on the basis object has a different name,
// the objects will still follow their basis objects
// Follow parents 1st to avoid frame delays
object.setX(basisObject.getCenterXInScene() + object.getX() - object.getCenterXInScene() + deltaX * Math.cos(angle) + deltaY * Math.sin(angle));
object.setY(basisObject.getCenterYInScene() + object.getY() - object.getCenterYInScene() - deltaX * Math.sin(angle) + deltaY * Math.cos(angle));
// Unproportional dimensions changes won't work as expected
// if the object angle is not null but nothing more can be done
// because there is no full affine transformation on objects.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Lim98SE
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: MouseHelper
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Turn any object into a cursor.
description: This extension allows to replace the cursor with an object.
Breaking change of the version 2.0.0:

- The button behavior has been removed. The button object can be used instead. Some ready to use buttons can be downloaded from the [Buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons) of the asset store.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Turn any object into a mouse cursor.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: cursor

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ButtonStates
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use any object as a button and change appearance according to user interactions.
description: Use the "Button states" behavior to track user interactions with an object, including:
- Hovered
- Pressed
- Clicked
- Idle
Add additional behaviors to make juicy buttons with animated responses to user input:
- Size
- Color
- Animation
- Object effects

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
description: Shake an object (position, angle or scale).
It can be used for:
- Hit or impact
- Object slowly rocking back and forth (like a ship)
- Simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
The top-down RPG example uses this extension for damage animations ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_.  Wait _PARAM6_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

eventsFunctions.description: Stop any shaking of object that was initiated by the Shake Object extension.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is shaking.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale)
This behavior can only be used on sprite objects.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_, and scale amplitude _PARAM6_.  Wait _PARAM7_ seconds between shakes.  Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM8_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amplitude of scale shake (in percent change)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerScale

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Silver-Streak, @Bouh, Tristan Rhodes
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: IsOnScreen
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This adds a condition to detect if an object is on screen based off its current layer.
description: This extension adds conditions to check if an object is located within the visible portion of its layer's camera. The condition also allows for specifying padding to the virtual screen border.
Note that this does not take into account any object visibility, such as being hidden or 0 opacity, but can be combined with those existing conditions.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
This behavior provides a condition to check if the object is located within the visible portion of its layer's camera. The condition also allows for specifying padding to the virtual screen border.
Note that object visibility, such as being hidden or 0 opacity, is not considered (but you can use those existing conditions in addition to this behavior).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: InOnScreen

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if an object position is within the viewport of its layer.
eventsFunctions.name: IsOnScreen

inlineCode: Get the object layer, convert the position from this layer to the screen coordinates.
Get the point on each side on the object on screen, and compare with the screen area.
This way even if the camera has a rotation or custom scale the object is always compared to the screen area.
// Get the layer of the object.
// Get the aabb of the object on his layer.
// Get the layer to convert the coordinates of the AABB to the screen coordinates
// Get the points on each side of the object on screen.
const posLeftObjectOnScreen = Math.min(topLeft[0], topRight[0], bottomLeft[0], bottomRight[0]);
const posRightObjectOnScreen = Math.max(topLeft[0], topRight[0], bottomLeft[0], bottomRight[0]);
const posUpObjectOnScreen = Math.min(topLeft[1], topRight[1], bottomLeft[1], bottomRight[1]);
const posDownObjectOnScreen = Math.max(topLeft[1], topRight[1], bottomLeft[1], bottomRight[1]);

parameters.longDescription: Number of pixels to pad the screen border. Zero by default. A negative value goes inside the screen, a positive value go outside.
parameters.name: Padding

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the label over the bar.
Pass the configuration to the behavior.

Children instances must be resized when the parent size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the parent
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value
- the label is put back at the center of the bar

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Recolorizer
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Independently change the colors of a sprite, a tiled sprite or a panel sprite.
description: This extension allows to restyle a sprite, a tiled sprite or a panel sprite.
It can be used to:
- Change the color of player short according to its team color.
- Add small color variation to trees of a forest.
- Restyle objects to match other assets.
An example shows how to change the 2 main colors of an object ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://recolorizer)).
This extension is experimental and might no longer work in future version of GDevelop.

eventsFunctions.description: Define JavaScript classes.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineJavaScript

inlineCode: * Converts an HSL color value to RGB. Conversion formula
* Assumes h, s, and l are contained in the set [0, 1] and
* returns r, g, and b in the set [0, 255].
var hue2rgb = function hue2rgb(p, q, t) {
var q = l < 0.5 ? l * (1 + s) : l + s - l * s;
* Converts an RGB color value to HSL. Conversion formula
* Assumes r, g, and b are contained in the set [0, 255] and
* returns h, s, and l in the set [0, 1].
var max = Math.max(r, g, b), min = Math.min(r, g, b);
s = l > 0.5 ? d / (2 - max - min) : d / (max + min);
case r: h = (g - b) / d + (g < b ? 6 : 0); break;
case g: h = (b - r) / d + 2; break;
case b: h = (r - g) / d + 4; break;
* Replace a color with an other one.
* @param {{x: number, y: number, width: number, height: number}} frame
* @param {[number, number, number]} originColor The color to replace from.
* @param {[number, number, number]} targetColor The color to replate to.
* @param {number} hueScope Pixels within the hue scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} saturationScope Pixels within the saturation scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} lighnessScope Pixels within the lightness scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
const recolorizeTexture = function (sourceCanvas, targetCanvas, frame, originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope) {
// hue is not knowned for graycase colors.
// graycase pixels must take the targeted hue
pixelHsl[0] = pixelSaturation === 0 ? targetHue : gdjs.evtTools.common.mod(pixelHue - originHue + targetHue, 1);
// white pixels must also take the targeted saturation.
* @param {[number, number, number]} originColor The color to replace from.
* @param {[number, number, number]} targetColor The color to replate to.
* @param {number} hueScope Pixels within the hue scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} saturationScope Pixels within the saturation scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} lighnessScope Pixels within the lightness scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
const getRecolorizationKey = function (originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope) {
* Manage recolorizations to ensure uniqueness of textures.
* Register a recolorization usage and get recolored textures.
* @param {Array<{originColor: [number, number, number], targetColor: [number, number, number], hueScope: number, saturationScope: number, lighnessScope: number}>} recolorizations
recolorizedSprite = { userCount: 0, textures: targetTextures, canvas: targetCanvas };
* Apply a recoloration to every textures.
* @param {Array<{originColor: [number, number, number], targetColor: [number, number, number], hueScope: number, saturationScope: number, lighnessScope: number}>} recolorizations
/** @type {Array<{originColor: [number, number, number], targetColor: [number, number, number], hueScope: number, saturationScope: number, lighnessScope: number}>} */
* Replace a color with an other one.
* @param {[number, number, number]} originColor The color to replace from.
* @param {[number, number, number]} targetColor The color to replate to.
* @param {number} hueScope Pixels within the hue scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} saturationScope Pixels within the saturation scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} lighnessScope Pixels within the lightness scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
Recolorizer.prototype.recolorizeSprite = function (originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope) {
this.recolorizationKey += getRecolorizationKey(originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope);
this.recolorizations.push({ originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope});
* Reset the default textures of the object.
* Update the textures of the object.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: VegeTato
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AnimationSystem
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds easy to use pre-made animations.
description: Helpful for making animations for sprites without having to spend time animating the character in editors
- You can use multi animations on one object to get more effects
- For the animations that do Not have Trigger once, you can use Timers to make it Have one !
- Added condition to check if the door is Open or Close from animation (3D open/close door)
- Added condition to check if the animation has finished (if trigger once set to YES)
- User can change the origin point of the object to control the animations
- Animation behavior must be installed in the object to make the extension works

eventsFunctions.description: From *3D open door* animation.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if the door is open
eventsFunctions.name: DoorIsOpen

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the selected animation has finished.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if the animation has finished
eventsFunctions.name: AnimationFinished

parameters.longDescription: Animation must be set to Trigger once in order to check if it finished

eventsBasedBehaviors.name: AnimationBehavior

eventsFunctions.name: AnimationSystem
eventsFunctions.sentence: Animate _PARAM0_ with animation _PARAM2_ at speed _PARAM3_ on width _PARAM4_ and height _PARAM5_ Trigger once? _PARAM6_

parameters: lerp(Object.Y(), Object.Variable(_.Animation system._Squash and Stretch Y) ,GetArgumentAsNumber("speed")*5)
lerp(Object.Y(), Object.Variable(_.Animation system._Squash and Stretch Y) ,GetArgumentAsNumber("speed")*5)

ToString(Object.Variable(_.Animation system._Low health color)) + ";" + ToString(Object.Variable(_.Animation system._Low health color RGB)) + ";" + ToString(Object.Variable(_.Animation system._Low health color RGB))

ToString(Object.Variable(_.Animation system._Low health color)) + ";" + ToString(Object.Variable(_.Animation system._Low health color RGB)) + ";" + ToString(Object.Variable(_.Animation system._Low health color RGB))

parameters.name: animations
parameters.supplementaryInformation: ["Pulse","Breath","Smooth rotation","Instant rotation","Wobble","Wobble2","Wobble3","Wobble once","3D rotation","3D rotation X","3D rotation Y","3D door loop","3D open door","3D close door","3D pre-closed door","Float","Triangle transition","Square transition","Rhombus transition","Maze transition","Fade loop","Fade out","Fade in","Squash & Stretch","Rainbow effect","Shake rotation","Shake horizontal","Shake vertical","Line rotation","Land","Low health"]

parameters.longDescription:
Animations information:  
Pulse/Breath: recommended speed, 0.03  
Smooth rotation: recommended speed, 5  
Wobble/wobble2/wobble3: Do not have trigger once/ recommended speed, 0.1  
Wobble once: Trigger once must be YES/ recommended speed, 0.1  
3D rotation: recommended speed, 1  
3D rotationX: recommended speed, 1.2  
3D rotationY: Origin point must be at center/ recommended speed, 1.2  
3D door loop: do not have trigger once/ recommended speed, 1.2  
3D open/close door: Trigger once must be YES/ recommended speed, 1.2  
3D pre-closed door: Trigger once must be YES/ speed doesn't matter  
Float: recommended speed, 0.02  
Triangle/Square/Rhombus/Maze transition: recommended speed, 3  
Fade loop: do not have trigger once/ recommended speed, 5  
Fade Out/In: Trigger once must be YES/ recommended speed, 5  
Squash&Stretch: recommended speed, 0.06  
Rainbow effect: The higher the speed the slower effect/ recommended speed, 1  
Shake rotation/Horizontal/Vertical: recommended speed, 4  
Line rotation: recommended speed, 3  
Land: Trigger once must be YES/ Best results, set the condition of the player to "is on floor" > start animation land / recommended speed, 5  
Low health: recommended speed, 30
parameters.name: height

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Entropy
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AdvancedJump
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Sports and Fitness/Sports and Fitness_training_running_run.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Let platformer characters: air jump, wall jump wall sliding, coyote time and dashing.
description: This extension provides behaviors to:
* Jump in mid-air
* Jump and slide against walls
* Dash horizontally
* Dash toward the floor

* Do coyote time, also known as "ledge tolerance". It lets players jumping even after their character is no longer touching the ground for a given amount of time. It aims to give players a feeling of control and reduce frustration.
An example allows to check it out ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer-moves)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let platformer characters jump shortly after leaving a platform and also jump in mid-air.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: AdvancedJump

events.comment: Avoid any side effect if the feature is not used.
The new value will be used next frame.
While in the coyote jump frame, the Object is treated as being on the floor. No air jump can happen.
When the object fall, it doesn't jump but air jumps must be allowed

The order of these events is important because the idle state is:
on the floor and jump key released but the 1st jump must not count.
Coyote time was disabled, so WasInTheAir may not have been updated for a long time.

eventsFunctions.description: Change the coyote time duration of an object (in seconds).

events.comment: Avoid a jump from the floor to do a wall jump because of the allowed timeframe.
Reset default character configuration when a jump that is not a wall jump happens (for instance an air jump).
To know when jumping from the floor or not.
Reset default character configuration when the character change of direction or start to fall.
When the character tries to move but can't actually move, it's against a wall.
Save the previous position for the wall detection.

To be permissive, when the jump key was pressed right before the character touch the wall,
it is still detected as a wall jump which reset the air jump counter.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SmoothCamera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_camcoder_gopro_go_pro_camera.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
description: The camera follows an object according to:
- a frame rate independent catch-up speed to make the scrolling from smooth to strong
- a maximum speed to do linear following ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer-with-tilemap)) or slow down the camera when teleporting the object
- a follow-free zone to avoid scrolling on small movements
- an offset to see further in one direction
- an extra delay and catch-up speed to give an impression of speed (useful for dash)
- position forecasting and delay to simulate a cameraman response time
A platformer dedicated behavior allows to switch of settings when the character is in air or on the floor. This can be used to stabilize the camera when jumping.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SmoothCamera

events.comment: Update private properties through setters to check their values and initialize state.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object. This action must be called after the object has moved for the frame.
eventsFunctions.name: MoveCameraCloser

events.comment: The camera following is called with an action, the call from doStepPreEvents must be disabled to avoid to do it twice.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object.
eventsFunctions.name: DoMoveCameraCloser

events.comment:
Delaying and forecasting can be used at the same time.
Forecasting only use the positions that are older than the one used for delaying.
The behavior uses a position history that is split in 2 arrays:
- one for delaying the position (from TimeFromStart to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay)
- one for forecasting the position (from TimeFromStart - CamearDelay to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay - ForecastHistoryDuration

At each frame, the camera must catchup the target by a given ratio (speed)
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1) - targetX) * speed

The frame rate must not impact on the catch-up speed, we don't want a speed in ratio per frame but a speed ratio per second, like this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1s) - targetX) * speed

Ok, but we still need to process each frame, we can use a exponent for this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * speed^timeDelta
cameraX(t) = targetX + (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * exp(timeDelta * ln(speed))

pow is probably more efficient than precalculated log if the speed is changed continuously but this might be rare enough.

eventsFunctions.description: Delay the camera according to a maximum speed and catch up the delay.
eventsFunctions.name: WaitAndCatchUp
eventsFunctions.sentence: Delay the camera of _PARAM0_ during: _PARAM2_ seconds according to the maximum speed _PARAM3_;_PARAM4_ seconds and catch up in _PARAM5_ seconds

events.comment: Maybe the catch-up show be done in constant pixel speed instead of constant time speed.

eventsFunctions.description: Update delayed position and delayed history. This is called in doStepPreEvents.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateDelayedPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Update delayed position and delayed history of _PARAM0_

events.comment: Add the previous position to have enough (2) positions to evaluate the extra delay for waiting mode.
Use the object center when no delay is asked.
Remove history entries that are too old to be useful for delaying and pass it to the history for forecasting.
Don't move the camera if there is not enough history.

Add the extra delay that could be needed to respect the speed limit in waiting mode.

speedRatio = min(speedMaxX / historySpeedX, speedMaxY / historySpeedY)
delay += min(0, timeDelta * (1 - speedRatio))
The time with delay is now between the first 2 indexes

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the camera following target is delayed from the object.
eventsFunctions.name: IsDelayed

eventsFunctions.description: Return the current camera delay.
eventsFunctions.name: CurrentDelay

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the camera following is waiting at a reduced speed.
eventsFunctions.name: IsWaiting

eventsFunctions.description: Add a position to the history for forecasting. This is called 2 times in UpadteDelayedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: AddForecastHistoryPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Add the time:_PARAM2_ and position: _PARAM3_; _PARAM4_ to the forecast history of _PARAM0_

events.comment:
Remove history entries that are too old to be useful.
Keep at least 2 positions because no forecast can be done with less positions.

eventsFunctions.description: Update forecasted position. This is called in doStepPreEvents.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateForecastedPosition

events.comment:
Simple linear regression
y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX

Note than we could use only one position every N positions to reduce the process time,
but if we really need efficient process JavaScript and circular queues are a must.

VarianceX = sum((X[i] - MeanX)²)
VarianceY = sum((Y[i] - MeanY)²)
Covariance = sum((X[i] - MeanX) * (Y[i] - MeanY))

y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX
Axis permutation to avoid a ratio between 2 numbers near 0.

eventsFunctions.description: Project history ends position to have the vector on the line from linear regression. This function is only called by UpdateForecastedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: ProjectHistoryEnds
eventsFunctions.sentence: Project history oldest: _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_ and newest position: _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_ of _PARAM0_

events.comment:
Perpendicular line:
pA = -1/a; 
pB = -pA * x + y

Intersection:
/ ProjectedY = a * ProjectedX + b
\ ProjectedY = pA * ProjectedX + b

Solution that is cleaned out from indeterminism (like 0 / 0 or infinity / infinity):
ProjectedX= (x + (y - b) * a) / (a² + 1)
ProjectedY = y + (x * a - y + b) / (a² + 1)

eventsFunctions.description: Return the ratio between forecast time and the duration of the history. This function is only called by UpdateForecastedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: ForecastTimeRatio
